title: WCAS POLI_SCI 101-6-21 First-Year Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Poli_Sci 101-6-21 "Wealth and Power in America" Benjamin Page, Winter 2017
This seminar explores the nature of economic inequality in the United States and the role of government in dealing with it. Special attention is paid to the political power of wealthy Americans, as opposed to that of other citizens: how much power they have; how they exercise it; for what purposes; and what public policies result.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Three very brief (2-page) papers, 15% each; one longer paper (10-12 pages), 30%; leadership and participation in class discussions, 25%
